Yes, there are many organizations and events that are open to the public and provide opportunities to learn more about astronomy and meet experts in the field. Here are a few examples:

1. Amateur Astronomers Association of New York - a non-profit organization that hosts public stargazing events, lectures, and workshops.

2. The American Astronomical Society - a professional organization that hosts an annual meeting, which includes some events open to the public.

3. International Observe the Moon Night - an annual event that invites the public to observe and learn about the moon.

4. NASA's Night Sky Network - a coalition of astronomy clubs and organizations that host public events throughout the year.

5. The Virtual Telescope Project - an online observatory that offers live broadcasts of celestial events, as well as online courses and workshops.

These are just a few examples, but there are many more opportunities to learn more about astronomy and meet experts in the field.
